Event.name: attendee
Event.description: A person or organization attending the event. Supersedes attendees.

Event.name: duration
Event.description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.

Event.name: endDate
Event.description: The end date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).

Event.name: eventStatus
Event.description: An eventStatus of an event represents its status; particularly useful when an event is cancelled or rescheduled.

Event.name: location
Event.description: The location of the event, organization or action.

Event.name: offers
Event.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, or give away tickets to an event.

Event.name: performer
Event.description: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor. Supersedes performers.

Event.name: previousStartDate
Event.description: Used in conjunction with eventStatus for rescheduled or cancelled events. This property contains the previously scheduled start date. For rescheduled events, the startDate property should be used for the newly scheduled start date. In the (rare) case of an event that has been postponed and rescheduled multiple times, this field may be repeated.

Event.name: recordedIn
Event.description: The CreativeWork that captured all or part of this Event. Inverse property: recordedAt.

Event.name: startDate
Event.description: The start date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).

Event.name: subEvent
Event.description: An Event that is part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each of which is a subEvent of the conference. Supersedes subEvents.

Event.name: superEvent
Event.description: An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent.

Event.name: typicalAgeRange
Event.description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

Event.name: workPerformed
Event.description: A work performed in some event, for example a play performed in a TheaterEvent.

Thing.name: additionalType
Thing.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

Thing.name: description
Thing.description: A short description of the item.

Thing.name: image
Thing.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

Thing.name: potentialAction
Thing.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

Thing.name: sameAs
Thing.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
